image.altText: A photo of Ola Ouda and Amjad Shehada taken from Facebook.

items.synopsis: Ola Ouda and Amjad Shehada were publicly humiliated when the federal police laid fraud charges against them. When the charges were dropped, it failed to make the headlines.

title.children: Shunned by friends, abused by strangers: The allegations that 'destroyed' a family's life

image.altText: Georgia Stanway celebrates

items.synopsis: England's well-fancied Lionesses take on Women's World Cup debutants Haiti in Brisbane. Earlier, former winners Japan and the USA recorded big wins over Zambia and Vietnam. Follow live.

title.children: Haiti still pushing for shock equaliser after England takes lead in Brisbane

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Half time in Brisbane and England take a narrow lead into the sheds. Not sure England will be too impressed with that - they've looked a little bit shaky at the back and have failed to find the killer pass or space to shoot despite having plenty of chances. Haiti have been very good though, particularly their front three and the longer this game goes on for with the score at 1-0, the longer the underdogs will fancy their chances. Also, a yellow card was just shown to Georgia Stanway just before the half time break. A rough tackle, born out of frustration really there for the England goalscorer, which sums it up really.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Half time: England 1-0 Haiti

children.content: Half time in Brisbane and England take a narrow lead into the sheds.
Not sure England will be too impressed with that - they've looked a little bit shaky at the back and have failed to find the killer pass or space to shoot despite having plenty of chances.
Haiti have been very good though, particularly their front three and the longer this game goes on for with the score at 1-0, the longer the underdogs will fancy their chances.
Also, a yellow card was just shown to Georgia Stanway just before the half time break.
A rough tackle, born out of frustration really there for the England goalscorer, which sums it up really.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Meanwhile, in New Zealand... New Zealand Football can confirm that the Football Ferns team and staff have been temporarily evacuated from the Pullman Hotel, their team base for the FIFA Women’s World Cup, due to a fire. All of the team and staff are safe and accounted for. Probably not the best prep between games for the co-hosts. They play the Phillipines on Tuesday in Wellington.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: New Zealand team evacuated from their hotel due to fire

children.content: New Zealand Football can confirm that the Football Ferns team and staff have been temporarily evacuated from the Pullman Hotel, their team base for the FIFA Women’s World Cup, due to a fire.
All of the team and staff are safe and accounted for.
Probably not the best prep between games for the co-hosts.
They play the Phillipines on Tuesday in Wellington.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Georgia Stanway makes no mistake this time and sends Kerly Théus the wrong way! England leads! Huge relief for the English.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 29' ENGLAND LEADS!

children.content: Georgia Stanway makes no mistake this time and sends Kerly Théus the wrong way!

image.altText: People in the Old Trafford stands have umbrellas up while covers are on the pitch and the rain falls.

items.synopsis: Rain sets in on day four of the fourth Ashes Test at Old Trafford, and Australia needs it to hang around to give them hope of salvaging a draw. Follow live.

title.children: Rain threatens to wash out day four of fourth Ashes Test at Old Trafford

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Rain. There's a chance we'll have some less damp patches, but the surface will likely still be pretty sodden and with little to no sunlight to dry it up, they'll be pushing it uphill to get out on the field.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: So, what's the actual forecast in Manchester?

props.alt: A screenshot of a weather forecast for Manchester.

children.content: There's a chance we'll have some less damp patches, but the surface will likely still be pretty sodden and with little to no sunlight to dry it up, they'll be pushing it uphill to get out on the field.

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

items.synopsis: A former Australian soldier tells the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide that no counselling was offered to staff at the base where a young man was killed during a training drill.

title.children: 'Sent back out to training': Former soldier alleges no counselling offered after fatal accident

image.altText: Boxes of vapes stacked next to each other on display

items.synopsis: The South Australian government launches a $2 million advertising blitz to reduce the number of people taking up vaping and smoking, with a special focus on young people.

title.children: Vaping, smoking targeted in new campaigns released by the SA government

image.altText: A car crashed into a traffic light.

items.synopsis: A man is reported for allegedly driving over the legal alcohol limit and crashing into an intersection in Adelaide's CBD. Meanwhile, police search for a driver connected to two hit-and-run crashes in the city's north.

title.children: Man who allegedly levelled Adelaide CBD traffic light reported for drink driving

image.altText: A man in camouflage gear puts his arm around a blonde woman

items.synopsis: While Igor Girkin may never face justice for killing 298 people on MH17, he could soon be jailed in the country that once protected him from prosecution.

title.children: 'They took my husband out under their arms': The man who downed MH17 finally sees his luck run out

image.altText: A woman in a hot pink bikini behind a bar in a pub, smiling.

items.synopsis: Is the industry really same name, totally different game? The ABC takes a look at how skimpy work has survived in regional Australia.

title.children: How skimpies – or bartenders in bikinis and bras – have survived post #MeToo

image.altText: Close-up photos of Gypsy Satterley and Jessica Townley

items.synopsis: Mother-of-two Gypsy Satterley and alpaca breeder Jessica Townley are remembered after their deaths in a horrific crash on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

title.children: 'Trustworthy', 'beautiful soul': Loved ones express heartbreak following highway triple fatality

image.altText: Three young man in hats and sunglasses clown for the camera, blue skies green hill, one guy  holds his hand in a rock sign.

items.synopsis: Some might have been underwhelmed by the line-up or turned off by memories of last year's mud, but an estimated 35,000 music fans still think Splendour in the Grass is worth saving up for.

title.children: Splendour in the Grass experience still sweet enough to attract thousands of music fans

image.altText: A man in a suit and a purple scarf celebrates on a pitch with a shield lifted over his head.

items.synopsis: Under Sage's ownership, the men's team claimed the premiership in 2019 and the women's team won a premiership in 2014.

title.children: Perth Glory goes into receivership, ending Tony Sage's ownership

image.altText: A lead singer and a guitarist, wearing tuxidos, perform on stage in front of a drum set.

items.synopsis: In videos posted on social media, the band's frontman Matty Healy can be seen kissing bassist Ross MacDonald after criticising the Malaysian government's stance against homosexuality in a profanity-laden speech to the festival audience.

title.children: Malaysia halts music festival after same-sex kiss by UK band The 1975

image.altText: Hands using a computer mouse and keyboard

items.synopsis: A man who allegedly helped launder more than $170,000 stolen from Australian businesses via email scams has been brought down by a year-long investigation.

title.children: Alleged cyber mule accused of stealing $170k via email scams targeting Australian businesses

image.altText: A man looks an an old oil refinery

items.synopsis: Tens of millions of dollars in Rio Tinto’s mining royalties are set to stop in the remote Northern Territory, as clan groups work urgently to cushion the blow.

title.children: 'I'd hate to see them lined up at Centrelink': The end looms for millions of dollars in mining payments

image.altText: A man makes an 'oh' shape with his mouth, reacting to a cricket delivery.

items.synopsis: Despite veteran English players backing Alex Carey, Jonny Bairstow says Australia set a poor example for kids with his Lord's dismissal.

title.children: Fiery Bairstow says Australia set a poor example for children with his controversial Lord's dismissal

image.altText: A composite image with both an aerial image of the eruption and a woman wearing exercise tights

items.synopsis: As the criminal trial over the deadly Whakaari White Island disaster continues, an emerging line of inquiry is what tourists were told to wear on the day of the eruption.

title.children: 'Cool down those leggings ASAP': Whakaari survivors answer questions on activewear

image.altText: Joe Biden standing at a podium wearing a blue suit and the US flag behind him.

items.synopsis: US President Joe Biden announces seven US companies have made voluntary commitments to ensure their AI products are safe before release.

title.children: OpenAI, Google and other AI companies agree to White House safeguards

image.altText: Meningococcal vaccines in a fridge

items.synopsis: SA Health says it has identified multiple people who had contact with the man and have directed them to take clearance antibiotics, as a 15-year-old is also admitted to hospital with the disease in a stable condition.

title.children: Man dies from invasive meningococcal disease in SA, child in hospital

image.altText: A screenshot of an Adelaide Review article in Spanish.

items.synopsis: Spanish opinion polling and data analysis has been posted to the defunct cultural magazine The Adelaide Review, in apparent attempt to circumvent Spanish electoral laws ahead of the country's upcoming general election.

title.children: Defunct Adelaide publication posts Spanish election poll results ahead of vote

image.altText: Two people look.

items.synopsis: When a massive power surge damaged their home's roller door, coffee machine and two air conditioning units, Gunta and Phillip Groves were left with an estimated damage bill of tens of thousands of dollars, without the support of insurance or compensation.

title.children: Couple left tens of thousands of dollars out of pocket after major power surge

image.altText: The stern of a very old oil tanker ship, showing rust patches all over the hull.

items.synopsis: For eight years, a rusted tanker carrying more than 1 million barrels of oil has sat neglected in the Red Sea, threatening to cause the world's worst oil-spill disaster. After years of planning, a daring salvage operation is now underway.

title.children: This ship is like a ticking time bomb floating on the Red Sea. Now begins a daring mission to stop it

image.altText: A firefighter works at a site of an administrative building heavily damaged by a Russian missile strike.

items.synopsis: The latest attacks on Ukrainian port cities damaged critical infrastructure and grain terminals. Experts say this latest escalation in the war could have far-reaching impacts on global food security.

title.children: Why is Russia bombing Ukraine ports and threatening Black Sea ships?

image.altText: A white man in dull clothing and a bright yellow cap kneels on the ground as he works in a square hole at a dig site.

items.synopsis: The result has confounded researchers, after geophysical surveys detected four anomalies that could indicate grave shafts, and cadaver dogs detected the scent of human remains.

title.children: Mystery continues as dig fails to turn up bodies of lost Native American schoolchildren

image.altText: A close-up of hands holding a large green and yellow rock

items.synopsis: Gemfields residents heard the tale of a 424-carat sapphire being found, but thought it was a tourism ploy. It turns out the stone is real and the lucky finder has returned to set the record straight.

title.children: The tall but true tale of how a retiree found a $300,000 gemstone in Queensland's Central Highlands

image.altText: Image of a man and a woman standing in front of a box.

items.synopsis: The plant-based bio-wrap industry is challenging the dominance of petroleum-based plastics, as consumers become increasingly willing to pay for environmentally friendly alternatives.

title.children: The company turning French fries into eco-friendly cling wrap

image.altText: A Collingwood AFL player attempts to mark the ball against Port Adelaide.

items.synopsis: Ladder leaders Collingwood meet second-placed Port Adelaide, while Fremantle plays the Sydney Swans. Earlier, the Brisbane Lions held off Geelong, and Richmond and Carlton enjoyed contrasting victories. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre.

title.children: AFL live: Power, Magpies locked in see-sawing clash as Dockers face Swans in the west

image.altText: Sarah Macdonald leaning against an orange wall, smiling.

items.synopsis: After badly breaking my ankle, I've become wholly dependent on others caring for me. It's made me feel needy, frustrated, vulnerable and yet deeply cared for.

title.children: 'My world has shrunk and slowed': What it's like relying on the kindness of others

image.altText: two women sit at a table and share a laugh over their laptops

items.synopsis: As we trickle back to our offices, I've witnessed a few of these encounters in lunch spots around the city: workers who are colleagues, but who obviously like each other enough to go and have lunch and shoot the breeze, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: In praise of the 'work wife', who makes going back to the office worthwhile

image.altText: Rear and side of a Victoria Police divisional van. Taken March 2023

items.synopsis: A 46-year-old Frankston North man who was tasered multiple times and shot with bean bags rounds while being subdued by Victoria Police following a siege on Thursday has died in hospital.

title.children: Man dies in hospital after being tasered by police during siege arrest

image.altText: Waves churned up after boat charges through ocean

items.synopsis: The Defence Department apologises to soldiers who could be left $15,000 worse off after a special allowance was suddenly scrapped.

title.children: 'Mind-blowing': Soldiers left thousands of dollars out of pocket in pay bungle

image.altText: Seven men and a dog stand in front of a rusty old Land Cruiser

items.synopsis: Crocodiles and sharks are the least of these diehard LandCruiser enthusiasts' worries as they prepare a 1978 vehicle for the undersea stunt. Remarkably, it's been attempted before.

title.children: 'Can't be that hard': Plan to drive 'rust bucket' LandCruiser 7kms across sea floor in Darwin Harbour
